comment: Strat-Conflict Transformation class. There were discussions weekly along with lab papers, and 2 papers as a midterm and final. The class is not difficult but there is a good amount of work. Professor Keever provides clear guidelines and rubrics, so as long as you do the work you are guaranteed an A. Great class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I took this class online for 1101 and it was a breeze. Includes mild reading and mostly just discussion posts and simple quizzes. There are a few writing assignments, but really all that matters is the word count. Super easy class and still learned a lot! 10/10
Due dates were hard to find and not properly organized on D2L. Take this class if you feel like digging through the entirety of your course home page every week just to find what's required of you.
She is a little strict on due dates, leniency, etc. She expects things done a certain way, but she also lays that out at the beginning of the semester, so you know exactly what is to be expected!

She is a phenomenal professor! I really enjoyed the content of the class plus she drops the lowest score for each category and her exams are straight from the textbook. She gave great feedback so it made me want to try with these assignments. You do need to be a good writer for most of her assignments but its no too bad. I recommend her!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Gives students PowerPoint notes that we fill in during lectures, so if you skip class and don't know anyone who can give you the notes you won't pass. There is no homework but for the course I took there was a midterm paper.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Many people had a problem with her in the beginning but I think shes great. You need to be a good writer as there are many essays and discussions but common sense will get you pretty far in this class. She drops the lowest grade in each category and her exams are open note. One major group project thats easy if you get a good group. Take her!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--So many papers

comment: The class is reading and writing heavy, fortuntely the material is engaging. I missed a testing deadline and she does not offer makeups but drops the lowest grades. It made me mad at first but talked to others on my groupme and she expects us to meet deadlines or get low grades. It taught me alot.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Its an online class so I appreciated that it was well organized. Prof Keever is extremely direct and this helped me to follow her rubrics because they are exactly what she expected. As long as you meet deadlines and follow directions from the syllabus you will pass. There is a group project but its sociology so makes sense.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Ms Keevers class is straightforward in terms of work. However, she has a very condescending attitude and is often rude when trying to email her. All instructions are very vague and she makes it seem like a chore to answer your emails asking for clarification. Easy class but the professor makes it harder than it needs to be. Wouldnt take again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader
